definition: see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)

sentences.english: Mei is a symbol of distinguishing spirit and moral integrity.
sentences.chinese: 梅也象征着人物高尚的精神和节操。

sentences.english: Our Corporate leaders are without patriotism and are open traitors to America.
sentences.chinese: 我们的企业领导人毫无爱国节操，公然背叛美国。

sentences.english: And, indeed, if I had stayed unchaste, I would have gotten burned out.
sentences.chinese: 的确，如果我保持无节操的，我会失去兴趣。

sentences.english: Let's burn incense in the memory of our pure past.
sentences.chinese: 焚香纪念我们逝去的节操。

sentences.english: Mei is a symbol of distingue spirit and moral integrity.
sentences.chinese: 梅也象征着人物高尚的精神和节操。

sentences.english: Zombie isn't my thing. Too much blood.
sentences.chinese: 不吓人，略血腥，很搞笑，无节操。

sentences.english: Pray for integrity in Chinas armed forces.
sentences.chinese: 为中国军人的节操祷告。

sentences.english: These actions stamp him as a man of high principles.
sentences.chinese: 这些行为显示出他是一个很有节操的人。

sentences.english: He is a man of high principle .
The pine is a badge of constancy.
